Technical Labs

Technical Labs is a series of labs being ran by Bath Computer Science Society (BCSS) intended to introduce useful technical skills.

These notes are intended to accompany in person labs covering the content in these labs.

Technical Labs is being led by Alfie Richards and Joseph Cryer. Email us if you have any questions or want to get involved!

It was heavily inspired by the Missing Semester series ran by MIT. We highly recommend these for those wanting more in depth content.

Schedule

  1. Command line basics (12/10/21)
  2. Local version control (26/10/21)
  3. Git remotes and GitHub (09/11/21)
  4. Code Editors (23/11/21)
  5. IDEâ€™s and Jupyter Notebooks (07/12/21)
  6. Debugging basics (15/02/02)
  7. Plugins and library managers (01/03/22)
  8. Backups and managing data (15/03/22)
  9. Continuous integration and docker (29/03/22)

Going beyond this series

This series is meant as an introduction to these concepts. The goal is to give an initial starting point, so that you can learn about them yourself and use them for your work!

Additionally, if you are a student at the University of Bath there are a lot of very knowledgable people on the Bath Computer Science Discord server who are nomally happy to help with any CS questions you may have!

Many of these tools have incredible communities who write very in-depth tutorials and manuals which can normally be found easily.

Trusting this series

We want you to feel confident in the information we are teaching. To accomplish this, our notes for these labs are being fact-checked by a variety of sources, including higher year students and lecturers.

Site made by Alfie Richards for Bath Computer Science Society and the Bath Computer Science Department.
